arts.ttl: Thursday’s briefing: Liverpool leave it late again as Harry Kane downs Chelsea
arts.sum: For the fifth match in a row, the Reds scored a winner after the 83rd minute to see off Atletico Madrid in their Champion League opener at Anfield.

arts.ttl: ‘It’s a red’: Enzo Maresca fumes after Bayern defender Tah avoids sending-off
arts.athr: Jacob Steinberg at the Allianz Arena
arts.sum: ‘To give you a red card, they need to see your blood’ Tah booked for first-half challenge on João Pedro Enzo Maresca blasted the officials after Bayern Munich made the most of Jonathan Tah avoiding a red card and gave Chelsea a rough introduction to life back in the Champions League. Chelsea’s head coach did not hide his anger with the Spanish referee, José Sánchez Martínez, for only booking Tah for a cynical challenge on João Pedro during the first half at the Allianz Arena on Wednesday night. Maresca was insistent that the Bayern defender should have been sent off after bringing João Pedro down during the buildup to Cole Palmer’s goal for Chelsea, who ended up opening the league phase with a 3-1 defeat to the Bundesliga champions. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Harry Kane says Champions League ‘more open’ than Bundesliga after netting 2 goals against Chelsea
arts.sum: Harry Kane says the Champions League offers more opportunities to score than the Bundesliga after he grabbed two goals in Bayern Munich’s 3-1 win over Chelsea on Wednesday. “I always feel like in the Champions League you create maybe more chances than the Bundesliga, the games are maybe a bit more open, and that suits me,” Kane told broadcaster DAZN.

arts.ttl: Chelsea are back in the Champions League, but Bayern prove too much to handle
arts.sum: For all their efforts, endeavor and eagerness in Munich, Chelsea's defense crumbled when it needed to be at its resolute best, and Harry Kane and his Bayern teammates profited to win 3-1 . And Kane, alongside the outstanding Michael Olise, were there to profit and unpick Chelsea's optimism to give them a nasty welcome back to the UEFA Champions League after a two-season hiatus.

arts.ttl: Player ratings: How did Bayern Munich's stars perform against Chelsea?
arts.sum: Bayern Munich claimed a convincing 3-1 win over Chelsea, showing their class in front of a buzzing home crowd. Here are all the player ratings for the Bavarians:

arts.ttl: Cole Palmer rues Chelsea's self-sabotage as Blues crumble against Bayern Munich - as star pinpoints where Enzo Maresca's side went wrong in Champions League opener
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL AT THE ALLIANZ ARENA: Palmer scored his own super strike but said all three goals that they conceded were their own fault as Kane gladly accepted the gifts to bag a brace.

arts.ttl: Harry Kane bags brace as Chelsea beaten by Bayern Munich in Champions League
arts.sum: Cole Palmer had given the Blues hope in Germany.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich, Chelsea starting lineups revealed! Does Palmer start Champions League opener?
arts.sum: Bayern Munich and Chelsea announce their starting lineups for Wednesday's Champions League fixture at the Allianz Arena.

arts.ttl: Confirmed lineups: Bayern Munich vs. Chelsea
arts.sum: The UEFA Champions League is back! Another year in which Bayern Munich is trying to become Kings of Europe once again has started - they will kick of their 2025/26 campaign against old rival Chelsea. Here are the confirmed lineups for this matchup.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich v Chelsea: Champions League – live
arts.sum: Updates from Allianz Arena | Liverpool v Atlético live Live scores | Follow us over on Bluesky | Email Luke “First of all, you know since last season, I always like to go game by game,’ the Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca revealed on Tuesday, in another jaw-dropping development. “You cannot think about the final or semi-final if you can’t win games in the group stage. “Tomorrow we have the first one against a fantastic team, one of the three or four favourites in this competition, but we are going to try to do our job in the best way.
